title: How important are these characteristics for developers of bioinformatics tools?

questions.name: open_source
questions.title: Is the code freely available?
questions.description: * 0.5: Code is freely available \n* 0.5: Tool can be run on a freely available platform \n

questions.name: version_control
questions.title: Is the code version controlled?
questions.description: * 1: Code is available on a public version controlled repository, such as Github \n

questions.name: dependencies
questions.title: Are dependencies clearly stated and available?
questions.description: * 0.5: Dependencies are clearly stated in the tutorial or in the code \n* 0.5: Dependencies are automatically installed \n

questions.name: license
questions.title: Is the license of the code clear? Does this license permit academic use?
questions.description: * 0.5: License of the code is clear \n* 0.5: License allows academic use \n

questions.name: programming_interface
questions.title: Does the tool have a programming interface?
questions.description: * 1: The tool can be run through the command line or through a programming language (in contrast to a GUI) \n

questions.name: style
questions.title: Do the functions have a consistent style?
questions.description: * 0.5: Code is styled consistently \n* 0.5: Code following (basic) good practices in the programming language of choice \n

questions.name: testing
questions.title: Does the package include some testing?
questions.description: * 0.5: Code contains unit tests \n* 0.5: Tests are run automatically using functionality from the programming language \n

questions.name: continuous_integration
questions.title: Does the package include some online continuous integration?
questions.description: * 1: Continuous integration, for example on Travis CI \n

questions.name: support
questions.title: Does the package include a system to ask for support?
questions.description: * 0.5: There is a support ticket system, for example on Github \n* 0.5: Tickets are closed within a reasonable time frame \n

questions.name: inline_documentation
questions.title: Is the code documented inline?
questions.description: * 1: Inline documentation in code for easier understanding of code \n

questions.name: unexpected_output
questions.title: Is unexpected output generated by the method?
questions.description:
* 0.25: No unexpected output messages 
* 0.25: No unexpected files, folders or plots are generated 
* 0.5: No unexpected warnings during runtime or compilation are generated
